channel.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
channel.description: Hey is there anyway I can play a Rsps on Ubuntu?(lunix) I have Wine and I try running the batch file in the wine cmd and still wont load up right, I was just wondering if it is even possible for me to play a rsps with this Operating System, if not im just gonna get windows back.

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:18, topic:443580”][quote author=Omer link=topic=546259.msg4064798#msg4064798 date=1343772355]

lunix really?..

it’s actually quite simple really.

You don’t have to create a sh file or anything.

Add the cache to the home root directory.( user.home) make sure the signlink reads from that. Use wine to play the jar.

…what…no…terrible…just no

Mattering upon your distro OP, install icedtea java through whatever [size=18pt]operation system program manager[/size] you use and then go from there.

do you mean package manager
[/quote]

Nice grave dig, and yes.[/quote]

1 month is hardly a grave dig, also the rule was changed a while ago if the post is relevant to the thread then you can bump a 5 year old thread if you wished.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:443580”]ah I see. The only two I’ve used a lot of is RHE and Ubuntu kernels.

and @ t4, not for me. If i got from fullscreen to liet’s say fixed, then to resize client it totally messes up. I’ll have to get on and take a screeny sometime later if I remember.[/quote]
sounds like that a driver issue for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:443580”]heh define decent. Even the runescape client for linux is horrid. ( I love playing in linux cause I can use hd lol ) but if I enlarge the client/resize it/etc it totally messes up the client screen.

Most annoying thing ever.

Ollie what version of ubuntu are you using anyway? I use a really old version ( like 7.04 or something like that )[/quote]
uhmmmm, rs2 client works 100% fine on linux platforms.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:9, topic:443580”]True, but it’s better to get accustomed to wine cause most windows based vb programs will not work without it.

Runescape/rsps is lucky to be in java[/quote]

While true, many good programs have native linux implementation nowadays, and if not then there is probably a decent linux alternative.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

Runescape/rsps is lucky to be in java

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Loveandpower:

the instructions I gave him are the easiest route to take for a new person at linux. Seriously guys he said “lunix” -.-=

Not quite. You don’t need wine to run a jar, or any java program. Java comes natively.

item.title: Playing RSPS on Lunix
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

if you can’t spell the kernel’s name correctly or understand what exactly a batch file is then you shouldn’t be using any Linux distribution… to answer your question, yes you should be able to play native since the Java Runtime Environment is available for Linux (this is assuming the client developer hasn’t used proprietary code).

Read full topic
